desc: A little about the Startup:At the moment it's an idea of the Startup of the cartoon with great potential! Because we will do our best in its promotion!After drawing characters, preparing for the presentation and solving all issues, the Startup will be presented in all studios in Russia and the United States. Active promotion and contract conclusion with the studio is planned for 2018.I suggest you take part in the Startup with me on the terms of a written agreement. At the beginning, there is no budget, so payment will be based on the result (first profit). But I guarantee the payment of labor, everything will be legally certified if necessary. Perhaps we will go together to present the idea in the US (paying expenses are on me). Also it is possible to create IOS,Android game applications before contract conclusion with a cartoon studio.If you do not want to take part in the Startup, but you want to get a fixed amount for drawing the characters, then we will also be able to agree.And now more about the work itself:There are sketches of 8 characters. The task of the project includes:- Detailed drawing of 2D characters- Creation of minimal animation for these characters (characteristic for each one, for example "chuckle", "embarrassment", "madness", etc.)- Experience is welcome, but not required. The main thing is computer animation skills, great desire and enthusiasm!Additionally it is possible:- Participate as a partner or just to be a part of the team in the launch of the Startup of animated cartoon and IOS,Android game applications.
title: Animator of the cartoon characters

desc: I work with a client that uses a Formlabs2, Netfabb and Preform to print out models of teeth. the build platform is shown in a pic that i'll attach. Before the files are added to preform for printing, they're taken into netfabb and details like patient info and Doctor name is added to the bottom of the model.Here's the task- if I use the following format to name a model file:[url removed, login to view]Can you build me a PC program that will use that filename info and allow me to dump 10-20 models into a box and then the program will automatically generate new STL's with patient, doctor, time and date info engraved into the base of each model. Not protruding, engraved. Possibly maybe even a pattern to add some aesthetics to the finished piece.Maybe drop a bunch of models, then a screen comes up with the files u just added with name and allows the user the option to manually edit the details and then they hit go and the files are processed and created.Currently, he's laying them out by hand in preform, if you can include an option to alternatively lay them out with the necessary space in between each model specifically for the form2, that would be the next step. A number of other labs are printing the models vertically, we havent tried that yet but would like to begin doing that. So then he would take the 1 file this program created and bring it into preformI have no idea where to start, the language that should be used, or if it's even possible. Let me know your thoughts and about how long it would take you
title: Add Engraved Patient Details to STL Model (Program)

desc: I have a 3D reference model generated from from a 2D image.I would like a 3D mesh created using the 3D model and 2D image as reference guides. The mesh should be clean and simple and capable of being rigged for animation. The mesh should include:i. Eye balls should be separate and capable of rigging.ii. Tongue and teethiii. Eyebrowsiv. Hair.The face mesh should have the following proportions:Oval-shaped, blue eyes: 0.46 distance apart from eye centresMedium-thick eyebrows, straight with curved ends: 0.07 distance above eyesSlim, mid-length, straight nose: 0.38 length, 0.11 wide at bridge and 0.26 wide at baseAverage lips (neither full nor thin): mouth 0.35 wideSquare jawline: chin 0.27 lengthOval-shaped face: 1 wide at eyes, 0.88 wide at mouth and 1.33 longBrunette hairNear perfect facial symmetry*Face width at the height of the eyes = 1 unit. All other measurements use this unit and are thus a ratio in proportion to it.In addition to the face there should be a texture to the skin. Texture should be HD quality (2K if possible) it would be great if upon render you could see the pores and stubble on the the skin. The reference image should form a base for the skin type. Ideally you have an existing skin texture which you can tweak and reuse for the model. You should supply a UV map and all additional textural objects (Normal Maps, Displacement maps, Colour maps etc..).Please note, supplied textures are of poor quality and so is the model. Most likely you'll need to recreate a face model from scratch - using the existing proportions as a template. Ideally you will have experience with modeling and rigging faces. Perhaps you have an existing male face which you could modify to fit my desired specifications.Final file should be a .obj or .blend format. Textures should be in .png.Reference image attached.Reference .obj and .png textures[url removed, login to view][url removed, login to view]
title: 3D face modelling

desc: Project DescriptionFully automated solution to modify an Adobe After Effects project in ten different places and then proceed to render the project. The modifications will be a combination of video and text changes. The modifications file can be produced in one of several formats (CSV, XML, or JSON).Assumptions/Criteria•	Every week a 10-item list will be generated. The list will contain all the items to be imported into the placeholders within the project. This list will consist of the following pieces of data:1)	order number – identifies which composition2)	player's name – text to include in text placeholder3)	player's team - text to include in text placeholder4)	video file location – the URL or local location of the video file (e.g., [url removed, login to view])•	rendered project will be approximately 90 to 120 seconds•	there are no 3rd party add-ons required•	video files will reside on Amazon S3 or can be copied to local system•	video files can be renamed so that the project always references the same file names (e.g., [url removed, login to view], [url removed, login to view], etc.)•	video files will range from 5 to 10 seconds each•	video files will play in full•	video files will have the correct resolution and aspect ration•	videos include audio, however the video audio is not needed in rendered output•	separate audio soundtrack is provided as part of project•	audio soundtrack will always be the sameFunctional Requirements•	for the purpose of this project, fully automated means changes to the project can be made entirely from the command line, can be scheduled or triggered by an event, can be passed additional parameters, and require no human intervention•	computer generated lists will be used to determine the required modifications to the project•	the correct video file and corresponding text will be imported into the correct composition•	the duration of each composition should dynamically accommodate its corresponding  video file•	as the duration of one composition is made the other composition will shift accordingly in the timeline to ensure smooth, seamless transitions•	Sending project to rendering farm, either as a complete project or multiple projects to create image sequences, should not be hampered
title: Adobe After Effects Automation

desc: You shall create a stillframe render of an exterior scene. It could be just an exterior environment, like an alley. Or it could be a product that happens to be shown in an exterior scene - like a bike, shoe or car. As part of this assignment you shall capture and gather a minimum of 50 reference images/videos of your item. Model your object based off of your references as accurate as possible. Your mesh type shall be of the type polygon. Create photo realistic materials by using procedural textures and maps where appropriate. Set up a lighting scenario to promote your item as a selling packshot or product visualization or lifestyle image. Present your current progress each and every day by using your dailies folder inside of your project. Keep in mind that we are looking for a realistic end result.1.3 PreparationThink of what kind of final image you would like to produce. What kind of feeling do you want your image to produce? Camera angles, moods and format plays a big part of this. Decide upon your item and then do the proper research, how is it used, built, coated, painted and such? Get to know everything about what you are trying to re-create. See the item/scene in person, go somewhere or to someone who might have it and ask to check it out. Bring your finest camera and take photos of everything.Folder structure:For this assignment you shall be using the default built in project system of Maya and it's default project structure. With the exception of adding a dailies and a references folder. Create a project in Maya, and create 2 custom folders named "dailies" and "references". When you are booting up a new session of Maya you will have to use the function 'set project' to sync your paths. This is very important to keep relative file paths. It is quite common for projects to get big so please clean out any and all unused files and versions. Aim to submit a project with the maximum size of 200mb. Make a .zip of your entire project and name it [url removed, login to view]". Where N is the number of your group. Make sure to remove "excessive" files, images, references and what not. We only want to save what is connected to your final maya [url removed, login to view] file:We don't need all different file versions for submission, leave only one file in the scenes folder named [url removed, login to view]'. Where N is your group number. Keep in mind that the output should be of ascii file format(.ma) and not binary(.mb). It is expected of you to have a nice and organized scene with everything named properly.Dailies:All of your dailies must be supplied in your projects dailies-folder. At the end of each day you simply take a few snapshots, playblasts and such and place it in a folder with todays date. NOTE that the dailies need to show in the filename WHO made them.exteriordailies2016-09-182016-09-192016-09-202016-09-21 and so on...You need at least one still image each and every day.Name your daily files to what they represent. Example: "[url removed, login to view]" or "[url removed, login to view]". Also make sure to put names or initials so it's easy to distinguish who's working on what.We expect it to be one folder for each working day.References:As you need a minimum of 50 references you will have to supply these aswell, these should all be placed inside of your 'references' folder. For extra credit, present them as collages as for example an A4-page with several images, it could have one page for shapereferences, one for material references etc.OutputFormat: EXRResolution: 1920x1080.Name: [url removed, login to view] (where N is your group-number)1.5 EquipmentSchools computers with Maya, Photoshop, Nuke and VRay
title: exterior scene
